result.execSummary:
The defendant Fernando Cortez Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Fernando Cortez Johnson was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Fernando Cortez Johnson is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Fernando Cortez Johnson was found guilty of Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Fernando Cortez Johnson was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Fernando Cortez Johnson was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The defendant is advised that as a convicted felon he/she may not carry or possess any firearms.  No contact with firearms.
The Court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

COUNTS 2 and 3:  Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges from bail on deposit.  If there is no posted bail the defendant is to pay the costs and surcharges during his extended supervision, failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: concurrent with count 1,  with 15 days credit.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Fernando Cortez Johnson in court with attorney Patrick James Rupich.  Defendant Fernando Cortez Johnson in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab

Statements as to sentencing by state and defense.  Additional statement/s by:   Precious B.
As to count 1:
  
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 4 years in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 15 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 2 years and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 years,  with the following conditions:
     *  Successfully complete any counseling and/or
         treatment deemed appropriate.
       *  Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges and his 
        supervision fees, bail on deposit to apply, remainder during his period of extended supervision.
     *  No contact with firearms.
     *  Defendant may have phone contact with the victim.  The court will not impose a no contact order between the victim and defendant.  
     *  The Court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence. 
         Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment signed by the defendant and filed.  
     *  Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs, pursuant to 973.047 of Wisconsin 
        statutes.
The defendant is advised that as a convicted felon he/she may not carry or possess any firearms.  
The defendant is advised of his/her appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Wisconsin Abuse Program.
.
Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, credit form, ineligible voting rights form.\

As to count 2:
  
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 6 months at the House of Correction, concurrent with count 1,  with 15 days credit.
Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges from bail on deposit.  If there is no posted bail the defendant is to pay the costs and surcharges during his extended supervision, failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  
Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

As to count 3:

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 30 days at the House of Correction, concurrent with count 1,  with 15 days credit.
Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges from bail on deposit.  If there is no posted bail the defendant is to pay the costs and surcharges during his extended supervision, failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  
Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 671
cf

The court is not in session on the previously calendared date of 12/16/2015.
Case rescheduled to 12/21/2016 at 08:30 a.m., for sentencing.
Defense counsel and the district attorney notified.  Defense counsel informed the court that the defendant is the House of Correction.  The court will have the defendant produced for the next court date.  Deputy Desmet in the bull pen notified on today's date of the need to have the defendant produced on the new sentencing date.
cab

Attorney Patrick James Rupich in court, defendant Fernando Cortez Johnson not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  cab
The jurors had a question and the parties are back in court.
The defendant did not wish to come to court for the verdict.
 At the hour of 2:10 p.m. the jury returned and by their foreperson, Jill F.,  brought in a verdict of GUILTY AS TO COUNTS 1, 2 and 3 and NOT GUILTY AS TO COUNT 4,  which was then read.    Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding.  Court ordered entry of judgments of conviction as to counts 1, 2 and 3.  Court ordered a judgment of acquittal as to count 4.
.
Case adjourned for sentencing in branch 36.
.
DEFENDANT REMANDED FOR SENTENCING.
.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for 12/16/2015 at 01:30 p.m.

Defendant Fernando Cortez Johnson in court with attorney Patrick James Rupich.  Defendant Fernando Cortez Johnson in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Jury in the box.  Defense rests.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror Roger S. selected by lot.  Jury retired at the hour of 10:37 a.m. to deliberate in charge of Deputy Sheriff Randall Tackacs and Detective Wesley Boone who were duly sworn for that purpose.   Jury out of box.
.
The jurors were released for the lunch hour...
.

Defendant Fernando Cortez Johnson in court with attorney Patrick James Rupich.  Defendant Fernando Cortez Johnson in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.

Jury panel in court at 1:34 pm.  Voir dire continued.  
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  

Court takes a short break.  Jury out of box at 2:47 pm.  Sidebar placed on record.  Jury back in box at 3:37 pm.

Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  MPD Officer Wayne Young. Exhibits  #1-6 received.  Sidebar held.  Jury out of box at 3:52 pm.  Jury back in box at 3:58 pm.  Testimony continued.  Sworn for the state:  Analyst Amy Lagueux.  Exhibits #7-9, 11, 12  received.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Sidebar held.  Court instructs jury and releases jury for the evening.  Jury out of box at 4:41 pm.  Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.  Defendant examined by the Court as to his right to remain silent and found defendant feely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to remain silent.  Court orders case adjourned for continued jury trial.  Jury trial scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Fernando Cortez Johnson in court with attorney Patrick James Rupich.  Defendant Fernando Cortez Johnson in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  cab
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  11:50 a.m.. The jury was released at 12:10 p.m.
.
Court adjourned for the lunch hour.  The court will continue voir dire at 1:30 p.m.

Attorney Patrick James Rupich in court, defendant Fernando Cortez Johnson not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

15RM027386  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06/01/2015
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Fernando Cortez Johnson in court with attorney Patrick James Rupich.  Defendant Fernando Cortez Johnson in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Wayne Young.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case is adjourned to Branch 36.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Precious B.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Fernando Cortez Johnson in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Fernando Cortez Johnson in custody.  
David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Defendant pleads Not Guilty as to all Misdemeanor Counts.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner advised DNA has NOT been obtained from the Defendant. Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriffs  Department to obtain DNA from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
